text:
> _"Have you looked at improved bundling prices for CMS Enterprise with Marketing hub? There are alot of crossover features if you have CMS enterprise"_
Three thoughts on this one:
• You can't host a website or web app on MH ... so if you need to build a digital experience (website, web app, event platform, etc), you need CMS Hub. 
• We are also adding many new CMS-only features (see roadmap). 
• There is already bundle discounting available + you can always try and negotiate with your sales rep :slightly_smiling_face:

> _"I look forward to hearing more about a lighter version, do you have a timescale on this?"_
We don't have a public date... but I'd just say "sit tight and keep your eyes peeled" :slightly_smiling_face:

> _"How far off are headless capabilities?"_
In terms of launching a robust omnichannel / headless solution... no timeline. We're committed to doing it and are actively scoping/planning phase.

BUT - The first step is decoupling the data layer from the presentation layer ... which is already underway and we're seeing some recent releass leveraging this (ex: Dynamic Pages and Page Content powered by CRM data). So depending on your use case, you _*might*_ be able to do what you need today.

This is one we're excited about, but we'll all need some patience as we want to do it right. If you have feedback/ideas - please ping me directly.

> _"You’re talking about blog DND functionality. Is this live?"_
Yes sir. :slightly_smiling_face: Not live, but <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Drag-amp-Drop-functionality-for-Blog-Posts/idi-p/408909#M74607|being worked on>. Sorry if my original reply miscommunicated that it was live now. There are some interesting nuances we are working through - taking a more time than expected. Appreciate your patience.

> _"can use the new sections on blogs"_
Sections (now in beta) can be used in blog listing pages.
